text.p: These are the leading stories in the Egyptian press on Thursday. Reuters has not verified these stories and does not vouch for their accuracy.

- Egyptian President Hosni Mubarak and Morocco's King Hussein during their summit in Morocco agree to increase ties between the two countries. Five agreements are signed to promote investment and increase bilateral trade and transportation. An increase in trade exchanges to $200 million is seen, as well as setting up a free trade zone and raising the capital of a joint holding company to $300 million.
- Authorities in Assiut catch three people stealing 40 rare antiquities. The value of the pieces was not given but they included statues of birds and people.

- Contacts between Egypt and Turkey are underway on the military exercises Turkey is holding with Israel. A Turkish official said in Ankara that the exercises are not strategic or aimed at sending a message to any country in the region. He said the exercises are focused on rescue and humanitarian operations.
- Social Development Fund agrees to finance 10 million pounds for youth programmes in various provinces. The projects will provide 3,527 job opportunities.
- President Mubarak's son Gamal, who is head of the U.S-Egyptian President Council, calls on the private sector to increase its participation in the economy.
